docs.snippet: Bakeries, groceries and banks were reopening last week in the Katanga capital of Elisabethville. Traffic police reappeared at street corners. Africans and Europeans circulated about the city and cleared away debris from last month's two-week battle...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bakeries, groceries and banks were reopening last week in the Katanga capital of Elisabethville. Traffic police reappeared at street corners. Africans and Europeans circulated about the city and cleared away debris from last month's two-week battle between United Nations and Katanga secessionist forces.

docs.snippet: The chanceries of the Western Hemisphere are busy these days preparing possible resolutions for the foreign ministers' meeting of the Organization of American States on Jan. 22 in Punta del Este, Uruguay, The aim is to agree on a collective attitude...
docs.lead_paragraph: The chanceries of the Western Hemisphere are busy these days preparing possible resolutions for the foreign ministers' meeting of the Organization of American States on Jan. 22 in Punta del Este, Uruguay, The aim is to agree on a collective attitude toward Cuba. Meanwhile, as he announced at a military celebration in Havana this Week, Premier Castro is preparing a monster rally for the same day "to reply to [Yankee] imperialism and its lackeys."
